description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Research Analyst Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-DataResearchAn.006<p><br></p>

Fay handles a wide range of mortgage loan solutions for prospective homeowners with varying credit histories and also offers refinancing for existing mortgages.<p><br></p>The Fay Group is made up of separate business units offering a complete range of home ownership products and services that provide customers with solutions to navigate the challenges of home ownership while helping them build toward their long-term financial goals.<p><br></p>Fay Cares!<p><br></p>While others in our industry focus on collecting money—or else—we take a kinder, more humane approach when homeowners fall short, explains CEO Ed Fay. We consider the people behind those mortgages and work hard to give them the best chance possible to stay in their homes.<p><br></p>The <strong>Fay-Constructive Foundation</strong> was established to fulfill the <strong>philanthropic mission of Fay Financial employees</strong> to serve the communities in which they live and work. Over 80% of employees across Fay, Constructive, and GenStone affiliate companies make voluntary contributions to the Foundation. Each quarter, their contributions are donated to organizations focused on improving education opportunities, combating poverty, and supporting military service members and first responders.<p><br></p>Come join us on our journey to serve our customers and be the leader in our industry! We are currently looking for a <strong>Quality Control Analyst II</strong> to join our team!<p><br></p><strong>What you will do for Fay:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ensures timely completion of monthly and quarterly mortgage servicing audits</li><li>Communicates accurate, concise, and constructive exception detail to clients</li><li>Takes management of assigned monthly QC reviews</li><li>Provides initial process recommendations to mitigate risks</li><li>Analyze statistical data against regulatory and company specifications to establish the quality and reliability of finished products/services. This includes researching loan documents and information housed on internal and external systems</li><li>Identify quality problems and recommend solutions</li><li>Monitor testing procedures to ensure that all tests are performed according to established item specifications, standard test methods, or protocols</li><li>Check all audit findings for completeness and accuracy</li><li>Escalates any evidence of fraud and/or misrepresentation to management</li><li>Responds promptly to staff and management as a subject matter expert for the scope assigned</li><li>Review findings to identify trends and suggest criteria or sampling adjustments</li><li>Assist in the implementation and tracking of quality indicators to identify opportunities for improvement</li><li>Contribute to ad hoc projects and testing as the need arises, e.g. creation of new test parameters and performing targeted process audits</li><li>Develop domain knowledge of business to include an understanding of organizational objectives.</li><li>Maintain broad influence through the ongoing development of relationships across the organization.</li><li>Ensure compliance with policies, processes, and practices</li><li>Role model ethical standards, professionalism, and code of conduct</li><li>Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What you will bring to Fay:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, relevant work experience; High school diploma/GED required</li><li>2+ years’ years of experience in Quality Control or Quality Assurance</li><li>2+ years’ of experience in mortgage production or operations experience</li><li>2+ years’ of experience in regulations and investor requirements associated with the Mortgage Industry</li><li>Familiarity with a mortgage application, processing &amp; closing documents, as well as industry-standard legal documents</li><li>Familiarity with mortgage software preferred</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Analytical and organizational skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task</li><li>Collaborative work style; high team-orientation</li><li>Open to change; agile; high learning agility</li><li>Strong analytical skills coupled with sound judgment</li><li>Strong problem-solving abilities</li><li>Ability to analyze and interpret data to identify opportunities and propose solutions</li><li>Strong project management skills</li><li>Strong skills in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint</li></ul><p><br></p>Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are deeply embedded into our way of working at Fay. We believe that the best ideas come from having a team that is diverse in backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorSoftware.002<p><br></p>
